itemDescription: 19th-century British photographer who had a career in Australia

wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Foster Chuck (19 September 1826 – 7 December 1898) was a British photographer. He was born in London and migrated to Australia, where he documented the explorers and early colonists of Victoria.

response: Important early professional photographers include William Glover Webb Freeman (1809–1855), Thomas Foster Chuck (1826–1898), Walter Woodbury (1834-1885), Nicholas Caire (1837–1918) and John Lindt (1845–1926).

Andrew Budds (1809–1893) is included in the famous photographic montage, published by Thomas Foster Chuck in 1872, entitled The Explorers and Early Colonists of Victoria. He appears as number 24 in the montage, and is listed as having arrived in Victoria, Australia in 1837.

link_mentions.page: The Explorers and Early Colonists of Victoria
response: The Explorers and Early Colonists of Victoria is a historical photographic montage of 1872 by Thomas Foster Chuck (1826–1898). It consists of a framed collection of 713 photographs of the early settlers of Victoria.

Azzopardi is included in the photographic montage published by Thomas Foster Chuck in 1872 entitled The Explorers and Early Colonists of Victoria. He is number 84 in the montage and is listed as “A. Azzopardi”.
* The Explorers and Early Colonists of Victoria, an 1872 historical photographic montage of early settlers in Victoria by Thomas Foster Chuck
